title: Job Openings at Chilis Restaurant
content:
Chilis Restaurant is a 24-hours restaurant with good quality of food and good services.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) CCTV Personnel

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Monitoring: Continuously monitoring CCTV footage to ensure safety and security.
	Incident Response: Responding promptly to incidents, such as theft or violence, and alerting management and authorities.
	Surveillance: Keeping watch on high-risk areas, like entrances, exits, and cash handling areas.
	Crime prevention: Deterrent effect, discouraging potential criminals from committing crimes.
	Investigation Assistance: Aiding investigators by providing footage and information related to incidents.
	Maintenance: Regularly checking and maintaining CCTV equipment to ensure optimal function.
	Quality Control: Ensuring footage quality and resolving technical issues.
	Training: Educating staff on CCTV usage and security protocols.
	Compliance: Ensuring CCTV usage complies with privacy laws and regulations.
	Incident Reporting: Documenting and reporting incidents to management and authorities.
	Its a 24hrs restaurant that runs morning, afternoon and night shifts
	Proximity to Ringroad is preferred.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 0-5 years of experience.


Salary
N50,000 - N60,000 per month. 

Application Closing Date: 30th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: chilisrestaurant.ibadan@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

2.) Pastry Assistant

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Pastry Preparation: Preparing and baking pastries, cakes, and other sweet treats.
	Decorating: Decorating cakes and pastries with intricate designs and patterns.
	Ingredient Management: Measuring, mixing, and preparing ingredients for pastry dough and fillings
	Equipment Maintenance: Cleaning and maintaining pastry equipment, such as mixers and ovens.
	Quality Control: Ensuring pastries are of high quality and meet presentation standards.
	Inventory Management: Managing inventory of pastry ingredients and supplies.
	Cleaning and Sanitation: Maintaining a clean and sanitary workspace, adhering to food safety regulations.
	Team Support: Assisting other pastry staff members with tasks and responsibilities as needed.
	Recipe Development: Assisting in developing new recipes and ideas for pastries and desserts.
	Plating and presentation: Presenting pastries and desserts attractively for service
	It is a 24hrs restaurant that runs morning, afternoon and night shifts.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 0-5 years of experience.
	Proximity to Awolowo is preferred.


Salary
N35,000 - N70,000 / Month.

Application Closing Date: 31st October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: chilisresaturant.ibadan@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Procurement Officer

Job Location: Ring Road - Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Supplier Selection: Finding and evaluating suppliers for ingredients, equipment, and services
	Contract Negotiation: Negotiating prices, terms, and conditions with suppliers.
	Purchasing: Buying ingredients, beverages, equipment, and supplies necessary for operations
	Inventory Management: Managing inventory levels, tracking usage, and optimising stock levels.
	Cost Control: Analysing prices, tracking expenses, and identifying opportunities for cost savings.
	Quality Control: Ensuring purchased products meet quality and safety standards.
	Supplier Relationship Management: Building and maintaining relationships with suppliers.
	Risk Management: Mitigating risks associated with supply chain disruptions, price fluctuations, and supplier insolvency.
	Compliance: Ensuring compliance with regulations, such as food safety and labeling requirements
	Data Analysis: Analysing procurement data to identify trends, optimize purchasing decisions, and improve operations
	Menu Engineering: Collaborating with chefs to develop menus that balance profitability and customer appeal.
	Waste Management: Minimising waste and optimizing inventory usage to reduce environment impact.
	Proximity to Ring Road is preferred


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 2 - 5 years of work experience.


Salary
N60,000 - N80,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 31st October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: chilisrestaurant.ibadan@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Openings at The Reddington Multi-specialist Hospital
content:
The Reddington Multi-specialist Hospital built on nine floors provides fully comprehensive tertiary hospital solutions in most medical areas. Our journey as a healthcare provider began in March 2006 with the establishment of the Cardiac Centre, in Victoria Island, in association with the renowned Cromwell Hospital in London.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Business Development and Marketing Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Main Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Promote Hospital Services: Champion the hospital’s brand and services and generate high-value leads through personal and professional networks, within the community, to corporate organisations, and to Health Maintenance Organisations (HMOs).
	Strategy: Provide leadership and strategic direction for marketing and sales strategies, processes, and standard operating procedures.
	Formulate quarterly strategies to drive revenue growth and market competitiveness.
	Identify and Acquire New Clients: Proactively source and approach potential business clients, HMOs, and other partners to grow our network and revenue streams.
	Relationship Management: Foster and maintain strong, long-term relationships with existing clients, ensuring high levels of satisfaction and loyalty.
	Contract Management: Oversee the initiation, negotiation, and renewal of contracts with clients, ensuring compliance and mutually beneficial agreements.
	Brand Ambassadorship: Act as the public face of the hospital group, representing our values and mission at events, presentations, and meetings.
	Content Oversight for Social Media: Lead the planning, creation, and management of content across all social media platforms to engage audiences and promote services.
	Proposal Documentation: Produce tailored customer proposals that address client-specific needs and expectations.
	Reporting: Deliver monthly performance reports and strategic insights to the CEO and senior management.


Qualification/Knowledge


	A University Degree in a relevant field.
	A postgraduate degree or professional certification in a related discipline. Strong knowledge and understanding of the Nigerian healthcare system. Extensive business and professional network.
	Membership of a recognized professional body in Marketing, Sales, or Communications.


Core Competencies and Skills:


	Excellent Communication: Superior verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to engage, persuade, and build trust with diverse stakeholders.
	Relationship Building: Demonstrated ability to establish and nurture professional relationships with clients, HMOs, and partners.
	Strategic Thinking: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify opportunities and develop effective business growth strategies.
	Negotiation and Contract Management: Proven experience in negotiating contracts, managing renewals, and ensuring mutually beneficial outcomes.
	Digital Savvy: Experience managing or overseeing social media content, with an understanding of digital marketing best practices.
	Organisational Skills: Highly organised, able to manage multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
	Professionalism and Integrity: Represents the hospital group with the highest standards of ethics, professionalism, and confidentiality.


Broad Key Performance Indicators:


	Achievement of annual revenue and new business targets.
	Growth of corporate client portfolio and strategic partnerships.
	Weekly activity benchmarks: calls, proposals, and conversion rates.
	Client retention and satisfaction metrics.
	Timely and accurate reporting to senior management.
	Development and maintenance of a robust customer relationship database.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV and Cover Letter to: hr@reddingtonhospital.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Quality Assurance Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Description


	The Quality Assurance Manager will be responsible for developing, implementing, and monitoring quality management systems to ensure compliance with healthcare standards, policies, and regulatory requirements.
	The ideal candidate will play a key role in promoting continuous quality improvement, patient safety, and clinical excellence within the organization.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop, implement, and oversee the hospital’s Quality Management and Patient Safety programs.
	Conduct regular quality audits and risk assessments to ensure compliance with national and international healthcare standards.
	Monitor and evaluate clinical and non-clinical processes to improve service delivery.
	Analyze data and prepare quality performance reports for management review.
	Facilitate incident reporting, root cause analysis, and corrective action implementation.
	Coordinate accreditation and certification processes.
	Provide training and support to staff on quality standards, safety, and best practices.
	Collaborate with department heads to identify and implement quality improvement initiatives.
	Promote a culture of excellence, accountability, and continuous learning across all units.


Requirements


	Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery (MBBS / MBChB) from a recognized institution.
	5–7 years of post-qualification experience, including at least 3 years in healthcare quality management, clinical governance, or hospital administration.
	Must be a licensed medical practitioner with a valid practicing license from the Medical and Dental Council of Nigeria (MDCN).
	Strong knowledge of clinical quality improvement frameworks, patient safety standards, and healthcare regulations.
	Experience with hospital accreditation systems (ISO, JCI, or COHSASA) is an added advantage.
	Excellent analytical, communication, and leadership skills.
	Proven ability to lead multidisciplinary teams and drive organizational change.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV and Cover Letter to: hr@reddingtonhospital.com and copy gabriel.akomolafe@reddingtonhospital.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
Or
Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Consultant Obstetrician & Gynaecologist

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Summary


	Reddington Hospital Group is seeking a qualified and experienced Consultant Obstetrician & Gynaecologist to join our multidisciplinary clinical team.
	The ideal candidate will provide high-quality specialist care in obstetrics and gynaecology, demonstrating clinical excellence, leadership, and a commitment to patient-centered service delivery.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide expert medical care in the management of obstetric and gynaecological conditions.
	Oversee antenatal, intrapartum, and postnatal care for patients.
	Perform surgical and non-surgical gynaecological procedures as required.
	Collaborate with other consultants, nurses, and healthcare professionals to ensure optimal patient outcomes.
	Participate in clinical meetings, training, and case reviews.
	Ensure compliance with professional and ethical standards of medical practice.
	Contribute to continuous quality improvement and clinical governance initiatives.


Requirements


	Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery (MBBS/MBChB) from a recognized institution.
	Minimum of 4 years of post-fellowship experience as a Consultant O&G Specialist.
	Fellowship of the West African College of Surgeons (WACS) or National Postgraduate Medical College of Nigeria (NPMCN) in Obstetrics & Gynaecology.
	Valid practicing license from the Medical and Dental Council of Nigeria (MDCN).
	Demonstrated expertise in both obstetric and gynaecological procedures.
	Excellent clinical judgment, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Proven ability to work effectively within a multidisciplinary team.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV and Cover Letter to: hr@reddingtonhospital.com and copy gabriel.akomolafe@reddingtonhospital.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
